SUB-FUNCS.SUB-FUNC: Service supported in active session.
Service not supported in active session.
This NRC shall be sent if the length of the message is wrong.
This NRC shall be sent if the total length of the response message exceeds the limit of the underlying transport protocol (e.g., when multiple DIDs are requested in a single request).

This NRC shall be returned if the criteria of the ECU Operation Mode for the Request Seed request is not met or the active diagnostics session in the server does not corresponds to a non-defaultSession or the requested Security level is not supported in current session.

This NRC shall be returned if: 1) the specified dataFormatIdentifier is not valid. 2) The specified addressAndLengthFormatIdentifier is not valid. 3) The specified memoryAddress/memorySize is not valid.
This shall be returned by the server if the server is in locked state and the client requested the 0x34 service. So the client shall unlock the ECU first before 0x34 request.

Service not supported in active session.

This NRC shall be sent if the sub-function parameter is not supported.
This NRC shall be sent if the length of the message is wrong.

This NRC shall be returned if the criteria of the ECU Operation Mode for the Request Seed request is not met or the active diagnostics session in the server does not corresponds to a non-defaultSession or the requested Security level is not supported in current session.

This NRC shall be returned if: 1) the specified dataFormatIdentifier is not valid. 2) The specified addressAndLengthFormatIdentifier is not valid. 3) The specified memoryAddress/memorySize is not valid.
This shall be returned by the server if the server is in locked state and the client requested the 0x34 service. So the client shall unlock the ECU first before 0x34 request.
If there are some faults for which the server can not perform the software download request.

This NRC shall be returned if the criteria of the ECU Operation Mode for the Request Seed request is not met or the active diagnostics session in the server does not corresponds to a non-defaultSession or the requested Security level is not supported in current session.

This NRC shall be returned if: 1) the specified dataFormatIdentifier is not valid. 2) The specified addressAndLengthFormatIdentifier is not valid. 3) The specified memoryAddress/memorySize is not valid.
This shall be returned by the server if the server is in locked state and the client requested the 0x34 service. So the client shall unlock the ECU first before 0x34 request.
If there are some faults for which the server can not perform the software download request.
